    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Actor
    The Actor class serves as the base class for all in-game actors.
    ActorLevelUp
    The ActorLevelUp class represents a power-up actor that grants the player increased firepower upon collection.
    AnimationComponent
    Handles animated effects for game components, such as explosions and level-up animations.
    Boss
    Represents the Boss enemy in the game.
    BossProjectile
    Represents a projectile used by the boss in the game, typically a fireball.
    BossTwo
    Represents the second boss in the game, featuring shooting, movement, animations, and health management.
    BossTwoProjectile
    Represents a projectile specifically designed for the second boss (BossTwo) in the game.
    BulletFactory
    A factory class for creating and resetting projectiles of different types.
    CollisionComponent
    Represents the collision component for an Actor, handling hitbox size, position, and collision checks.
    Controller
    The Controller class serves as the central hub for managing the game's stages, levels, and transitions between different scenes such as the main menu, game levels, and settings page.
    Destructible
    Interface representing objects that can be destroyed and take damage.
    EnemyPlaneOne
    Represents an enemy plane actor in the game.
    EnemyPlaneTwo
    Represents an advanced enemy plane (EnemyPlaneTwo) in the game.
    EnemyProjectile
    The EnemyProjectile class represents a projectile fired by an enemy in the game.
    GameOverImage
    The GameOverImage class represents the game over screen image.
    GameSettings
    A utility class that holds global game settings for the application.
    HealthComponent
    Represents a component for managing the health of an Actor.
    HealthComponent.HealthObserver
    Interface for observing health changes.
    HeartDisplay
    The HeartDisplay class is responsible for displaying and managing a visual representation of hearts as a life indicator.
    HeartItem
    The HeartItem class represents a heart-shaped item in the game that restores health to the player when picked up.
    Hitbox
    The Hitbox interface defines the methods that must be implemented by any class representing an object with a rectangular hitbox.
    KeyBindings
    A singleton class for managing key bindings used in the application.
    LevelChangeListener
    Interface to listen for level change events in the game.
    LevelOne
    Represents the first level of the game.
    LevelParent
    Abstract class representing a generic game level in the application.
    LevelThree
    Represents the third level in the game.
    LevelTwo
    LevelTwo represents the second level of the game, featuring a boss battle, power-ups, and a transition to the next level.
    Main
    The main entry point for the Sky Battle application.
    MainMenu
    Represents the main menu of the application, providing options to start the game, open the settings, or exit the game.
    MovementComponent
    Represents a movement component that controls the velocity and movement of an Actor.
    ObjectFactory<T>
    A generic interface for creating and resetting objects, typically used in object pooling mechanisms.
    ObjectPool<T>
    A generic object pool implementation that reuses objects to minimize resource allocation and enhance performance.
    Projectile
    Represents a projectile in the game.
    SettingsPage
    The SettingsPage class represents a user interface for managing game settings such as key bindings and audio volume levels for background music (BGM) and sound effects (SFX).
    Shield
    Represents a Shield actor in the game, which serves as a protective entity.
    ShootingComponent
    The ShootingComponent handles the shooting functionality of an Actor.
    SoundComponent
    The SoundComponent class is responsible for managing the game's background music (BGM) and sound effects (SFX).
    UserPlane
    Represents the player's aircraft in the game, including movement, shooting, and power-up functionality.
    UserProjectile
    Represents a projectile fired by the user in the game.
    WinImage
    Represents the "You Win" image that is displayed when the player achieves a victory in the game.
